intro: Microlicia rivularis, commonly known as the river microlicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have four to five petals, with a distinctive yellow or white coloration.
